iOS,macOS.name: ManagedExtensions_genericKey_State
iOS,macOS.description:
Controls whether an extension is allowed.
* Allowed - The user is allowed to turn the extension on or off
* AlwaysOn - The extension will always be on
* AlwaysOff - The extension will always be off

iOS,macOS.name: CalDAVAccountDescription
iOS,macOS.description: The description of the account.

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPAccountUseSSL
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables SSL.

iOS,macOS.name: Passwords_item_Password
iOS,macOS.description: The password for the AirPlay destination.

iOS,macOS.name: Settings_item_MDMOptions_MDMOptions
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary of MDM options.

iOS,macOS.name: Name
iOS,macOS.description:
The user-visible name for the font. This field is replaced by the actual name of the font after installation. Each payload must contain exactly one font file in trueType (.ttf) or OpenType (.otf) format. Collection formats (.ttc or .otc) are not supported.

Fonts are identified by their embedded PostScript names. Two fonts with the same PostScript name are considered to be the same font even if their contents differ. Installing two different fonts with the same PostScript name isn't supported, and the resulting behavior is undefined.

iOS,macOS.name: RemovalPassword
iOS,macOS.description: The password for allowing the profile to be removed.

iOS,macOS.name: DelayInDays
iOS,macOS.description: Specify the number of days that should pass before a deadline is enforced after a new update is released by Apple.

iOS,macOS.name: AirPrint
iOS,macOS.description: A list of AirPrint printers that are presented to the user.

iOS,macOS.name: forceClassroomUnpromptedScreenObservation
iOS,macOS.description: If 'true' and 'ScreenObservationPermissionModificationAllowed' is also 'true' in the Education payload, a student enrolled in a managed course through the Classroom app automatically gives permission to that course teacher's requests to observe the student's screen without prompting the student. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 11 and later, and macOS 10.14.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowAddingGameCenterFriends
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prohibits adding friends to Game Center. As of iOS 13, requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 4.2.1 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowWallpaperModification
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prevents wallpaper from being changed. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 9 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_ShowInLockScreen
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables notifications on the lock screen for this app. Available in iOS 9.3 and later and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_NotificationsEnabled
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables notifications for this app. Available in iOS 9.3 and later and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: minComplexChars
iOS,macOS.description: The minimum number of complex characters that a passcode must contain. A complex character is a character other than a number or a letter, such as & % $ #. This property is ignored for User Enrollments.

iOS,macOS.name: customRegex_passwordContentDescription_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: A localized description.

iOS,macOS.name: TeamIdentifier
iOS,macOS.description: This value must be apple for the Kerberos extension.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_isDefaultRealm
iOS,macOS.description: This property specifies it is the default realm if there is more than one Kerberos extension configuration.

iOS,macOS.name: Hosts
iOS,macOS.description: One or more host or domain names for which the app extension performs SSO. Host or domain names are matched case-insensitively, and all the host/domain names of all installed Extensible SSO payloads must be unique. Hosts that begin with a “.” are wildcard suffixes and will match all subdomains, otherwise the host must be an exact match.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_credentialBundleIdACL
iOS,macOS.description: A list of bundle IDs allowed to access the ticket-granting ticket (TGT).

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_OfflineGracePeriod
iOS,macOS.description: The amount of time after the last successful Platform SSO login a local account password can be used offline. Required when 'AllowOfflineGracePeriod' is set.

iOS,macOS.name: Type
iOS,macOS.description: The type of SSO.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.extensiblesso
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AuthenticationGracePeriod
iOS,macOS.description: The amount of time after a 'FileVaultPolicy', 'LoginPolicy', or 'UnlockPolicy' is received or updated that unregistered local accounts can be used. Required when 'AllowAuthenticationGracePeriod' is set.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: Keys and values to pass to the app extension.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_ActionParameters
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary that provides per-connection rules.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules
iOS,macOS.description: An array of rules defining the DNS settings. If rules are not present, the system always applies the DNS settings. These rules are identical to the OnDemandRules array in VPN payloads.

iOS,macOS.name: DNSSettings_ServerAddresses
iOS,macOS.description: An unordered list of DNS server IP address strings. These IP addresses can be a mixture of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

iOS,macOS.name: ProhibitDisablement
iOS,macOS.description: If true, prohibits users from disabling DNS settings. This key is only available on supervised devices.

iOS,macOS.name: DNSSettings_DNSProtocol
iOS,macOS.description: The encrypted transport protocol used to communicate with the DNS server.

iOS,macOS.name: AutomaticActions
iOS,macOS.description: Specifies various automatic Software Update functionality. Only applicable on Supervised devices with iOS 18+ and MacOS 15+

iOS,macOS.name: Password
iOS,macOS.description: The password for the service.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyPACURL
iOS,macOS.description: The URL of the PAC file that defines the proxy configuration. Starting in iOS 13 and macOS 10.15, only URLs that begin with http:// or https:// are allowed.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.configuration.safari.extensions.settings
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPSearchSettings_item_LDAPSearchSettingScope
iOS,macOS.description:
The type of recursion to use in the search. It is one of the following values:

Base: Only the immediate node that the search base points to.

One Level: The node plus its immediate children.

Subtree: The node plus all children, regardless of depth.

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPSearchSettings_item_LDAPSearchSettingDescription
iOS,macOS.description: The description of this search setting.

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPAccountHostName
iOS,macOS.description: The server’s address.

iOS,macOS.name: Passwords_item_DeviceName
iOS,macOS.description: The name of the AirPlay destination; used in iOS.

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_ScientificMode
iOS,macOS.description: If present, configures the scientific mode of the calculator. If not present, scientific mode is enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_MathNotesMode_Enabled
iOS,macOS.description: Controls whether the mode is enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: TargetOSVersion
iOS,macOS.description: The target OS version to update the device to by the appropriate time. This is the OS version number, for example, '16.1'. It may also include a supplemental version identifier, for example, '16.1.1'.

iOS,macOS.name: AirPrint_item_IPAddress
iOS,macOS.description: The IP address or hostname of the AirPrint destination.

iOS,macOS.name: allowGenmoji
iOS,macOS.description: When false, prohibits creating new Genmoji.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.applicationaccess
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: allowCloudKeychainSync
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables iCloud keychain synchronization. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 7 and later and macOS 10.12 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowCamera
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables the camera, and its icon is removed from the Home screen. Users are unable to take photographs. Requires a supervised device.  Available in iOS 4 and later, and macOS 10.11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowDictation
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disallows dictation input. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 10.3 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowiPhoneMirroring
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prohibits the use of iPhone Mirroring. When used on macOS, this prevents the Mac from mirroring any iPhone. When used on iOS, this prevents the iPhone from mirroring to any Mac.

iOS,macOS.name: forceOnDeviceOnlyDictation
iOS,macOS.description: If true, disables connections to Siri servers for the purposes of dictation. Available in iOS 14.5 and later. Also available for user enrollment.

iOS,macOS.name: allowExternalIntelligenceIntegrationsSignIn
iOS,macOS.displayName: Allow External Intelligence Integrations Sign In
iOS,macOS.description: If false, forces external intelligence providers into anonymous mode. If a user is already signed in to an external intelligence provider, applying this restriction will cause them to be signed out.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_BundleIdentifier
iOS,macOS.description: The bundle identifier of the app to which to apply these notification settings. Available in iOS 9.3 and later and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: pinHistory
iOS,macOS.description: This value defines N, where the new passcode must be unique within the last N entries in the passcode history.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_domainRealmMapping_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: The key should be the name of the realm, and the value is an array of DNS suffixes that map to the realm.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_domainRealmMapping
iOS,macOS.description: The name of the realm.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_helpText
iOS,macOS.description: The text to be displayed to the user at the bottom of the Kerberos login window. It can be used to display help information or disclaimer text. Available in iOS 14 and later and macOS 11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_siteCode
iOS,macOS.description: The name of the Active Directory site the Kerberos extension should use. Most administrators will never need to modify this value, as the Kerberos extension can normally find the site automatically.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_domainRealmMapping
iOS,macOS.description: A custom domain-realm mapping for Kerberos. This is used when the DNS name of hosts do not match the realm name. Most administrators will not need to customize this.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_principalName
iOS,macOS.description: The principal (aka username) to use. You do not need to include the realm.

iOS,macOS.name: MinimumLength
iOS,macOS.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters a passcode can contain.

iOS,macOS.name: URLs
iOS,macOS.description: An array of URL prefixes of identity providers where the app extension performs SSO. Required for Redirect payloads. Ignored for Credential payloads. The URLs must begin with http:// or https://, the scheme and host name are matched case-insensitively, query parameters and URL fragments are not allowed, and the URLs of all installed Extensible SSO payloads must be unique.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_UnlockPolicy
iOS,macOS.description: The policy to apply when using Platform SSO at screensaver unlock.  Applies when 'AuthenticationMethod' is `Password`.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_DNSServerAddressMatch
iOS,macOS.description: An array of IP addresses. This rule matches if any of the network’s specified DNS servers match any entry in the array.

iOS,macOS.name: DNSSettings_SupplementalMatchDomains
iOS,macOS.description: A list of domain strings used to determine which DNS queries will use the DNS server. If this array is not provided, all domains will use the DNS server.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta_OfferPrograms_item_Description
iOS,macOS.description: A human readable description of the beta program.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta_RequireProgram_Description
iOS,macOS.description: A human readable description of the beta program.

iOS,macOS.name: RapidSecurityResponse_Enable
iOS,macOS.description: If 'false', Rapid Security Responses are not offered for user installation. Rapid Security Responses can still be installed via 'com.apple.configuration.softwareupdate.enforcement.specific' configurations. If 'true', Rapid Security Responses are offered to the user.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta
iOS,macOS.description: Configurations for controlling or specifying the beta programs associated with a device. Only applicable on Supervised devices with iOS 18+ and MacOS 15+

iOS,macOS.name: RapidSecurityResponse
iOS,macOS.description: These configurations allow for setting user access to interacting with Rapid Security Responses (RSRs). Only applicable on Supervised devices with iOS 18+ and MacOS 15+

iOS,macOS.name: AutomaticActions_Download
iOS,macOS.description:
Specifies whether automatic downloads of available updates can be controlled by the user:
* "Allowed" - the user can enable or disable automatic downloads.
* "AlwaysOn" - automatic downloads are always enabled.
* "AlwaysOff" - automatic downloads are always disabled.

iOS,macOS.name: ManagedExtensions_genericKey_PrivateBrowsing
iOS,macOS.description:
Controls whether an extension is allowed in Private Browsing.
* Allowed - The user is allowed to turn the extension on or off in Private Browsing
* AlwaysOn - The extension will always be on in Private Browsing if the extension is on outside of Private Browsing
* AlwaysOff - The extension will never be on in Private Browsing

iOS,macOS.name: CalDAVHostName
iOS,macOS.description: The server’s address.

iOS,macOS.name: CardDAVHostName
iOS,macOS.description: The server’s address.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.carddav.account
iOS,macOS.description: com.apple.carddav.account

iOS,macOS.name: CardDAVUseSSL
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables SSL.

iOS,macOS.name: AllowList
iOS,macOS.description: If present, only AirPlay destinations in this list are available to the device. This allow list applies to supervised devices.

iOS,macOS.name: Passwords
iOS,macOS.description: The password for the AirPlay destination.

iOS,macOS.name: Settings_item_MDMOptions_MDMOptions_ActivationLockAllowedWhileSupervised
iOS,macOS.description: If 'true', a supervised device registers itself with Activation Lock when the user enables Find My. This setting is available for supervised devices in iOS 7 and later, and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: Settings_item_Bluetooth_Enabled
iOS,macOS.description: If 'true', enable the Bluetooth setting. If 'false', disable the Bluetooth setting.

iOS,macOS.name: SystemBehavior
iOS,macOS.description: If present, configures math behavior in the system.

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_ProgrammerMode_Enabled
iOS,macOS.description: Controls whether the mode is enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_ScientificMode_Enabled
iOS,macOS.description: Controls whether the mode is enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: DetailsURL
iOS,macOS.description: The URL of a web page that shows details that the organization provides about the enforced update.

iOS,macOS.name: DDM-LatestSoftwareUpdate
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: AirPrint_item_ResourcePath
iOS,macOS.description: The resource path associated with the printer. This path corresponds to the rp parameter of the _ipps.tcp Bonjour record. For example:  printers/Canon_MG5300_series, printers/Xerox_Phaser_7600, ipp/print, Epson_IPP_Printer

iOS,macOS.name: allowPasswordProximityRequests
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables requesting passwords from nearby devices. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 12 and later, and macOS 10.14 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowFingerprintForUnlock
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prevents Touch ID or Face ID from unlocking a device. Available in iOS 7 and later, and macOS 10.12.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowAccountModification
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables account modification. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 7 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates
iOS,macOS.description: If true, delays user visibility of software updates. In macOS, seed build updates are allowed, without delay. The delay is 30 days unless Enforced Software Update Delay is set to another value. Available in iOS 11.3 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowMultiplayerGaming
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prohibits multiplayer gaming. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 4.1 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowFingerprintModification
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prevents the user from modifying Touch ID or Face ID. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 8.3 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowRemoteScreenObservation
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables remote screen observation by the Classroom app. If Allow Screen Shot is set to false, the Classroom app doesn't observe remote screens. Required a supervised device until iOS 13 and macOS 10.15. Available in iOS 12 and later, and macOS 10.14.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowExplicitContent
iOS,macOS.description: If false, hides explicit music or video content purchased from the iTunes Store. Explicit content is marked as such by content providers, such as record labels, when sold through the iTunes Store. As of iOS 13, requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: forceClassroomRequestPermissionToLeaveClasses
iOS,macOS.displayName: Force Classroom Request Permission To Leave Classes
iOS,macOS.description: If true, a student enrolled in an unmanaged course through Classroom requests permission from the teacher when attempting to leave the course. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 11.3 and later, and macOS 10.14.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.notificationsettings
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: forcePIN
iOS,macOS.description: If true, forces the user to enter a PIN.

iOS,macOS.name: maxFailedAttempts
iOS,macOS.description: The number of allowed failed attempts to enter the passcode at the device's lock screen. After six failed attempts, a time delay is imposed before a passcode can be entered again. The delay increases with each attempt. In macOS, set Minutes Until Failed Login Reset to define a delay before the next passcode can be entered. When this number is exceeded in macOS, the device is locked; in iOS, the device is wiped.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_domainRealmMapping_genericKey_Kerberos
iOS,macOS.description: An array of DNS Suffixes that map to the realm.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.extensiblesso
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_requireUserPresence
iOS,macOS.description: If true, requires the user to provide Touch ID, Face ID or their passcode to access the keychain entry.

iOS,macOS.name: CustomRegex_Description_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: A localized description.

iOS,macOS.name: CustomRegex_Description
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary with supported OS language IDs for the keys (such as 'en-US'), and values that represent a localized description of the policy that the regular expression enforces. Use the special 'default' key for languages that the dictionary doesn't contain.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AccountDisplayName
iOS,macOS.description: The display name for the account in notifications and authentication requests.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary of arbitrary data passed through to the app extension.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_LoginFrequency
iOS,macOS.description: The frequency where a full login is required instead of a refresh. Default is 18 hours. Must be > 1 hour.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData
iOS,macOS.description: Additional extension-specific data to pass to the app extension.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AuthenticationMethod
iOS,macOS.description: The Platform SSO authentication method to be used with the extension. Requires that the SSO Extension also support the method.

iOS,macOS.name: ScreenLockedBehavior
iOS,macOS.description: When set to Do Not Handle, the request continues without SSO. Available in iOS 15 and later and macOS 12 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AuthorizationGroups
iOS,macOS.description: The pairing of Authorization Rights to group names. The Authorization Right will be updated to use the group when used.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_UseSharedDeviceKeys
iOS,macOS.description: If set to true, Platform SSO will use the same signing and encryption keys for all users.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_NewUserAuthorizationMode
iOS,macOS.description:
This setting affects the permissions for accounts created at login by Platform SSO. It is only used when the account is created. Use of the following:
* Standard
    The account will be a standard user.
* Admin
    The account will be added to the local administrators group.
* Groups
    The account will be assigned groups using the 'AdministratorGroups', 'AdditionalGroups', or 'AuthorizationGroups'.

iOS,macOS.name: DNSSettings_ServerURL
iOS,macOS.description: The URI template of a DNS-over-HTTPS server, as defined in RFC 8484. This URL must use the https:// scheme, and the hostname or address in the URL will be used to validate the server certificate. If no ServerAddresses are provided, the hostname or address in the URL will be used to determine the server addresses. This key must be present only if the DNSProtocol is HTTPS.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.dnsSettings.managed
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: AutomaticActions_InstallOSUpdates
iOS,macOS.description:
Specifies whether automatic install of available OS updates can be controlled by the user:
* "Allowed" - the user can enable or disable automatic installs.
* "AlwaysOn" - automatic installs are always enabled.
* "AlwaysOff" - automatic installs are always disabled.

iOS,macOS.name: FilterType
iOS,macOS.description: The type of filter, built-in or plug-in. In macOS, the system supports only the plug-in value.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.proxy.http.global
iOS,macOS.description: com.apple.proxy.http.global

iOS,macOS.name: ManagedExtensions_genericKey_DeniedDomains
iOS,macOS.description: Controls the domains and sub-domains the extension is not allowed to access. Any non-prefixed domains take precedence over prefixed domains, and DeniedDomains takes precedence over AllowedDomains. Any domains not specified in AllowedDomains or DeniedDomains are configurable by the user.

iOS,macOS.name: ManagedExtensions_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: The composed identifier of the managed extension, or "*" for all extensions. In order for the extension to be managed, its host app must be present on the device.

iOS,macOS.name: CalDAVPort
iOS,macOS.description: The server’s port.

iOS,macOS.name: CalDAVPassword
iOS,macOS.description: The user’s password. This is only used with encrypted profiles.

iOS,macOS.name: CardDAVPort
iOS,macOS.description: The server’s port.

iOS,macOS.name: Font
iOS,macOS.description: The contents of the font file.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.configuration.softwareupdate.enforcement.specific
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.profileRemovalPassword
iOS,macOS.description: com.apple.profileRemovalPassword

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: safariAllowAutoFill
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables Safari AutoFill for passwords, contact info, and credit cards and also prevents the Keychain from being used for AutoFill. Though third-party password managers are allowed and apps can use AutoFill. As of iOS 13, requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 4 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowDiagnosticSubmission
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prevents the device from automatically submitting diagnostic reports to Apple. Available in iOS 6 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later. Also available for user enrollment.

iOS,macOS.name: allowPasscodeModification
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prevents the device passcode from being added, changed, or removed. This restriction is ignored by Shared iPads. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 9 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: forceClassroomUnpromptedAppAndDeviceLock
iOS,macOS.displayName: Force Classroom Unprompted App And Device Lock
iOS,macOS.description: If true, allows the teacher to lock apps or the device without prompting the student. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 11 and later, and macOS 10.14.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowApplePersonalizedAdvertising
iOS,macOS.description: If false, limits Apple personalized advertising. Available in iOS 14 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowBookstoreErotica
iOS,macOS.description: If false, the user can’t download Apple Books media that is tagged as erotica. Available in iOS 6 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowDefinitionLookup
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables definition lookup. Requires a supervised device on iOS. Available in iOS 8.1.3 and later and macOS 10.11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowPasswordAutoFill
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables the AutoFill Passwords feature in iOS (with Keychain and third-party password managers) and the user isn’t prompted to use a saved password in Safari or in apps. This restriction also disables Automatic Strong Passwords, and strong passwords are no longer suggested to users. It doesn’t prevent AutoFill for contact info and credit cards in Safari. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 12 and later, and macOS 10.14 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowImagePlayground
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prohibits the use of image generation.

iOS,macOS.name: allowBluetoothModification
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prevents modification of Bluetooth settings. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: Type
iOS,macOS.description: This value must be Credential for the Kerberos extension.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_requireTLSForLDAP
iOS,macOS.description: Require that LDAP connections use TLS. Available in macOS 11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_customUsernameLabel
iOS,macOS.description: The custom user name label used in the Kerberos extension instead of “Username”. For example, “Company ID”. Available in macOS 11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_performKerberosOnly
iOS,macOS.description: If true, the Kerberos Extension handles Kerberos requests only. It doesn’t check for password expiration, show the password expiration in the menu, check for external password changes, perform password sync, or retrieve the home directory. Available in macOS 13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: MaximumPasscodeAgeInDays
iOS,macOS.description: Specifies the maximum number of days that the passcode can remain unchanged. After this number of days, the system forces the user to change the passcode before it unlocks the device.

iOS,macOS.name: RequireAlphanumericPasscode
iOS,macOS.description: If 'true', the passcode needs to consist of at least one alphabetic character and at least one number.

iOS,macOS.name: RequirePasscode
iOS,macOS.description: Specifies whether the user is forced to set a passcode. Setting this value, without any other keys present, forces the user to enter a passcode, without imposing a length or quality. The presence of any of the other keys implicitly requires a passcode be present on the device, and this key is ignored.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_TokenToUserMapping_FullName
iOS,macOS.description: The claim name to use for the user's full name.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_EnableCreateUserAtLogin
iOS,macOS.description: Enables creating new users at the login window with either Passwords or SmartCards. Requires 'UseSharedDeviceKeys' is true.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_UserAuthorizationMode
iOS,macOS.description:
This setting affects the permissions after authentication by Platform SSO. It is applied each time user authenticates. Use of the following:
* Standard
    The account will be a standard user. It will be removed from the 'admin' group.
* Admin
    The account will be added to the local administrators group.
* Groups
    The account will be assigned groups using the 'AdministratorGroups', 'AdditionalGroups', or 'AuthorizationGroups'.

iOS,macOS.name: DNSSettings
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary that defines a configuration for an encrypted DNS server.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta_RequireProgram_Token
iOS,macOS.description: The Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager seeding service token for the organization the MDM server is part of. This token is used to enroll the device in the corresponding beta program.

iOS,macOS.name: AllowListBookmarks_item_Title
iOS,macOS.description: The title of the bookmark.

iOS,macOS.name: AllowListBookmarks_item_URL
iOS,macOS.description: The URL of the bookmark in the allow list.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.webcontent-filter
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: ManagedExtensions_genericKey_AllowedDomains
iOS,macOS.description: Controls the domains and sub-domains the extension is granted access to. Any non-prefixed domains take precedence over prefixed domains, and DeniedDomains takes precedence over AllowedDomains. Any domains not specified in AllowedDomains or DeniedDomains are configurable by the user.

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPAccountPassword
iOS,macOS.description: The user’s password. The password is enabled only with encrypted profiles.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.airplay
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_InputModes
iOS,macOS.description: If present, controls global input options of the calculator. If not present, all input modes are enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: SystemBehavior_MathNotes
iOS,macOS.description: Controls whether Math Notes is allowed in other apps such as Notes.

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_InputModes_UnitConversion
iOS,macOS.description: Configures whether unit conversions are enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: TargetBuildVersion
iOS,macOS.description: The target build version to update the device to by the appropriate time, for example, '20A242'. The system uses the build version for testing during seeding periods. The build version can include a supplemental version identifier, for example, '20A242a'. If the build version isn't consistent with the target OS version specified in the 'TargetOSVersion' key, the target OS version takes precedence.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.domains
iOS,macOS.description: com.apple.domains

iOS,macOS.name: allowFindMyDevice
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables Find My Device in the Find My app. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowRapidSecurityResponseRemoval
iOS,macOS.description: If false, users are unable to remove the Rapid Security Response option.

iOS,macOS.name: allowDeviceNameModification
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prevents the user from changing the device name. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 9 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowRapidSecurityResponseInstallation
iOS,macOS.description: If false, Rapid Security Response will be disabled.

iOS,macOS.name: allowUIConfigurationProfileInstallation
iOS,macOS.description: If false, prohibits the user from installing configuration profiles and certificates interactively. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 6 and later and macOS 13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowSpotlightInternetResults
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables Spotlight Internet search results in Siri Suggestions. Available in iOS 8 and later, and macOS 10.11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowMailSmartReplies
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables smart replies in Mail.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings
iOS,macOS.description: An array of notification settings dictionaries.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_CriticalAlertEnabled
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables critical alerts that can ignore Do Not Disturb and ringer settings for this app. Available in iOS 12 and later and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_SoundsEnabled
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables sounds for this app.

iOS,macOS.name: allowSimple
iOS,macOS.description: If true, allows a simple passcode. A simple passcode contains repeated characters, or increasing or decreasing characters (such as 123 or CBA). Setting this value to false has the same result as setting Min Complex Characters to 1.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData
iOS,macOS.description: This is the dictionary used by the Apple built-in Kerberos extension.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_credentialUseMode
iOS,macOS.description: This setting affects how the Kerberos Extension credential is used by other processes.

iOS,macOS.name: Realm
iOS,macOS.description: The Kerberos realm, which should be properly capitalized. If in an Active Directory forest, this is the realm where the user logs in.

iOS,macOS.name: CustomRegex_Regex
iOS,macOS.description: A regular expression string to match against the password to determine whether it complies with a policy. The regular expression uses the ICU syntax. The string can't exceed 2048 characters in length.

iOS,macOS.name: MinimumComplexCharacters
iOS,macOS.description: Specifies the minimum number of complex characters in the password. A complex character is a character other than a number or a letter, such as '&', '%', '$', and '#'.

iOS,macOS.name: RequireComplexPasscode
iOS,macOS.description: If set to true, a complex passcode is required. A complex passcode is one that does not contain repeated characters, or increasing/decreasing characters (such as 123 or CBA), but must contain at least one non-number/non-letter character.

iOS,macOS.name: Hosts
iOS,macOS.description:
An array of host names or domain names that apps can authenticate through the app extension.
Required for Credential payloads. Ignored for Redirect payloads.

Host or domain names are matched case-insensitively, and all the host/domain names of all installed Extensible SSO payloads must be unique.

Hosts that begin with a “.” are wildcard suffixes and match all subdomains; otherwise the host must be an exact match.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: Keys and values to pass to the app extension.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_LoginPolicy
iOS,macOS.description: The policy to apply when using Platform SSO at the login window.  Applies when 'AuthenticationMethod' is `Password`.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AuthorizationGroups_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: The key is an access right value, the value is the group to be associated with that access right.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_TokenToUserMapping_AccountName
iOS,macOS.description: The claim name to use for the user's account name.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_SSIDMatch
iOS,macOS.description: An array of SSIDs to match against the current network. If the network is not a Wi-Fi network or if the SSID does not appear in this array, the match fails. Omit this key and the corresponding array to match against any SSID.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_DNSDomainMatch
iOS,macOS.description: An array of domain names. This rule matches if any of the domain names in the specified list matches any domain in the device’s search domains list.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_ActionParameters_Domains
iOS,macOS.description: The domains for which this evaluation applies.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta_RequireProgram
iOS,macOS.description: The device automatically enrolls in this beta program. This key must only be present if the `ProgramEnrollment` key is set to `AlwaysOn`. The `OfferPrograms` key must not be present if this key is present.

iOS,macOS.name: Deferrals
iOS,macOS.description: Controls the deferral of software updates. Rapid Security Responses are not considered within 'Major', 'Minor', or 'System' deferral mechanism. Only applicable on Supervised devices with iOS 18+ and MacOS 15++

iOS,macOS.name: Notifications
iOS,macOS.description: If 'true', the device shows all software update enforcement notifications. If 'false', the device only shows notifications triggered one hour before the enforcement deadline, and the restart countdown notification. Only applicable on Supervised devices with iOS 18+ and MacOS 15+

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.configuration.softwareupdate.settings
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: Organization
iOS,macOS.description: The organization string that passes to the third-party plug-in.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyType
iOS,macOS.description: The proxy type. For a manual proxy type, the profile contains the proxy server address, including its port, and optionally a user name and password. For an auto proxy type, you can enter a PAC URL.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyServer
iOS,macOS.description: The proxy server's network address.

iOS,macOS.name: ManagedExtensions
iOS,macOS.description: Extensions being managed

iOS,macOS.name: CardDAVPassword
iOS,macOS.description: The user’s password.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.ldap.account
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPAccountDescription
iOS,macOS.description: The description of the account.

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPAccountUserName
iOS,macOS.description: The user name.

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_MathNotesMode
iOS,macOS.description: If present, configures the Math Notes mode of the calculator. If not present, math notes mode is enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: CrossSiteTrackingPreventionRelaxedApps
iOS,macOS.displayName: Cross Site Tracking Prevention Relaxed Apps
iOS,macOS.description: An array of up to 10 strings representing app bundle-ids. Apps matching the bundle-ids listed here will have relaxed enforcement of cross-site tracking prevention for the domains listed in the 'CrossSiteTrackingPreventionRelaxedDomains' key.

iOS,macOS.name: InstallTime
iOS,macOS.description: Specify the local device time for when updates are enforced. This setting uses the 24-hour clock format where midnight is 00:00 and 11:59pm is 23:59. Ensure that you include the leading 0 on single digit hours. For example, 01:00, 02:00, 03:00.

iOS,macOS.name: allowAirDrop
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables AirDrop. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 7 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowFindMyFriends
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables Find My Friends in the Find My app. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowNotesTranscriptionSummary
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables transcription summarization in Notes.

iOS,macOS.name: allowExternalIntelligenceIntegrations
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables the use of external, cloud-based intelligence services with Siri.

iOS,macOS.name: allowedExternalIntelligenceWorkspaceIDs
iOS,macOS.description: Array of strings, but currently restricted to a single element. If present, Apple Intelligence will only allow the given external integration workspace ID to be used, and will require a sign-in in order to make requests; the user will be required to sign in to integrations that support signing in. Multiple payloads will combine using an intersect operation. This means the allowed set of workspace IDs can become the empty set if conflicting values are specified in multiple payloads.

iOS,macOS.name: allowAppleIntelligenceReport
iOS,macOS.description: When false, disables Apple Intelligence reports.

iOS,macOS.name: allowAutoUnlock
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disallows auto unlock. Available in macOS 10.12 and later, and iOS 14.5 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowGameCenter
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables Game Center, and its icon is removed from the Home screen. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 6 and later, and macOS 10.13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowAssistant
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables Siri. Available in iOS 5 and later. Also available for user enrollment.

iOS,macOS.name: allowBookstore
iOS,macOS.description: If false, removes the Book Store tab from the Books app. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 6 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_ShowInNotificationCenter
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables notifications in the notification center for this app. Available in iOS 9.3 and later and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: requireAlphanumeric
iOS,macOS.description: If true, requires alphabetic characters (abcd) instead of only numeric characters.

iOS,macOS.name: minLength
iOS,macOS.description: The minimum overall length of the passcode. This parameter is independent of the also optional Min Complex Characters argument.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_includeManagedAppsInBundleIdACL
iOS,macOS.displayName: Include Managed Apps In Bundle ID ACL
iOS,macOS.description: If true, the Kerberos extension allows only managed apps to access and use the credential. This is in addition to the Credential Bundle ID ACL, if it is specified. Available in iOS 14 and later, and macOS 12 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionIdentifier
iOS,macOS.description: This value must be com.apple.AppSSOKerberos.KerberosExtension for this extension.

iOS,macOS.name: CustomRegex_Description
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary with supported OS language IDs for the keys (such as 'en-US'), and values that represent a localized description of the policy that the regular expression enforces. Use the special 'default' key for languages that the dictionary doesn't contain.

iOS,macOS.name: MaximumGracePeriodInMinutes
iOS,macOS.description:
Specifies the maximum period that a user can select, during which a device can be unlocked without entering the passcode. A value of 0 implies no grace period, and requires a passcode be entered immediately. In the absence of this key, the user can select any period.
In macOS, this will be translated to screensaver settings.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.configuration.passcode.settings
iOS,macOS.description: Use this configuration to define passcode policy settings

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: Keys and values to pass to the app extension.

iOS,macOS.name: DeniedBundleIdentifiers
iOS,macOS.description:
An array of bundle identifiers of apps that don't use SSO provided by this extension.
Available in iOS 15 and later and macOS 12 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AdministratorGroups
iOS,macOS.description: The list of groups that are used for administrator access. Membership will be requested during authentication.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_FileVaultPolicy
iOS,macOS.description: The policy to apply when using Platform SSO at FileVault unlock on Apple Silicon Macs.  Applies when 'AuthenticationMethod' is `Password`.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_NonPlatformSSOAccounts
iOS,macOS.description: The list of local accounts that are not subject to the 'FileVaultPolicy', 'LoginPolicy', or 'UnlockPolicy'.  The accounts are also not prompted to register for Platform SSO.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_ActionParameters_item_DomainAction
iOS,macOS.description:
The DNS settings behavior for the specified domains. Allowed values:

* 'NeverConnect': Don't use the DNS Settings for the specified domains.
* 'ConnectIfNeeded': Allow using the DNS Settings for the specified domains.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_ActionParameters_DomainAction
iOS,macOS.description: The DNS settings behavior for the specified domains.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta_ProgramEnrollment
iOS,macOS.description:
Specifies whether beta program enrollment can be controlled by the user in software update settings UI:
* "Allowed" - the user can enroll in any applicable beta programs associated with their
  logged in Apple ID. If the `OfferPrograms` key is present, then the programs listed in
  that key are also presented to the user.
* "AlwaysOn" - the beta programs specified by the organization are used, and the user
  is not be able to enroll in a beta program using their logged in Apple ID. The device
  is automatically enrolled into the beta program specified by the `RequireProgram` key if
  it is present. Otherwise, the programs listed in the `OfferPrograms` key are
  presented to the user to choose which to enroll with.
* "AlwaysOff" - The device is not allowed to enroll in any beta programs. The device is
  removed from any beta programs, if already enrolled.

iOS,macOS.name: ServerAddress
iOS,macOS.description: The server address, which may be the IP address, hostname, or URL.

iOS,macOS.name: PluginBundleID
iOS,macOS.description: The bundle ID of the plug-in that provides filtering service.

iOS,macOS.name: CalDAVUseSSL
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables SSL.

iOS,macOS.name: CalDAVUsername
iOS,macOS.description: The user name for logins.

iOS,macOS.name: CardDAVAccountDescription
iOS,macOS.description: The description of the account.

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPSearchSettings_item_LDAPSearchSettingSearchBase
iOS,macOS.description: The path to the node where a search should start.

iOS,macOS.name: Settings_item_MDMOptions
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary that contains settings related to the MDM protocol. This setting doesn't support User Enrollment, and is available in iOS 7 and later, and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.font
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator
iOS,macOS.description: If present, configures the built-in Calculator app.

iOS,macOS.name: TargetLocalDateTime
iOS,macOS.description: The local date time value that specifies when to force install the software update. If the user doesn’t trigger the software update before this time, the device force installs it

iOS,macOS.name: EmailDomains
iOS,macOS.description: An array of domains. Email addresses that lack a suffix matching any of these strings are considered out of domain and marked in Mail.

iOS,macOS.name: CrossSiteTrackingPreventionRelaxedDomains
iOS,macOS.displayName: Cross Site Tracking Prevention Relaxed Domains
iOS,macOS.description:
Specify an array of up to ten domains 
when cross-site tracking is required for functionality.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowMusicService
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables the Music service, and the Music app reverts to classic mode. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 9.3 and later, and macOS 10.12 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowNotesTranscription
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables transcription in Notes.

iOS,macOS.name: allowCloudDocumentSync
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables document and key-value syncing to iCloud. As of iOS 13, this restriction requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 5 and later, and macOS 10.11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: forceAssistantProfanityFilter
iOS,macOS.description: If true, forces the use of the profanity filter assistant. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 11 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowEraseContentAndSettings
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables the Erase All Content And Settings option in the Reset UI. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 8 and later, and macOS 12 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowScreenShot
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables saving a screenshot of the display and capturing a screen recording. It also disables the Classroom app from observing remote screens. Available in iOS 4 and later, and macOS 10.14.4 and later. Also available for user enrollment.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_AlertType
iOS,macOS.description: The type of alert for notifications for this app. Available in iOS 9.3 and later and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.mobiledevice.passwordpolicy
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: maxPINAgeInDays
iOS,macOS.description: The number of days for which the passcode can remain unchanged. After this number of days, the user is forced to change the passcode before the device is unlocked.

iOS,macOS.name: customRegex_passwordContentRegex
iOS,macOS.description: A regular expression string that they system matches against the password to determine whether it complies with a policy. The regular expression uses the ICU syntax (<https://unicode-org.github.io/icu/userguide/strings/regexp.html>). The string must not exceed 2048 characters in length.

iOS,macOS.name: customRegex_passwordContentDescription
iOS,macOS.description: Contains a dictionary of keys for supported OS language IDs (for example, “en-US”), and whose values represent a localized description of the policy enforced by the regular expression. Use the special 'default' key can for languages that aren't contained in the dictionary.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_useSiteAutoDiscovery
iOS,macOS.description: If false, the Kerberos extension doesn't automatically use LDAP and DNS to determine its AD site name.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_allowAutomaticLogin
iOS,macOS.description: If false, passwords are not allowed to be saved to the keychain.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_preferredKDCs
iOS,macOS.description: The ordered list of perferred Key Distribution Centers (KDCs) to use for Kerberos traffic. Use this if the servers are not discoverable via DNS. If the servers are specified, then they are used for both connectivity checks and attempted first for Kerberos traffic. If the servers do not respond, then the device falls back to DNS discovery. Each entry is formatted the same as it would be in a krb5.conf file.

iOS,macOS.name: MaximumFailedAttempts
iOS,macOS.description: Specifies the number of failed passcode attempts that can be made before an iOS device is erased or a macOS device is locked. If you don’t change this setting, after six failed attempts, the device imposes a time delay before a passcode can be entered again. The time delay increases with each failed attempt. After the final failed attempt, all data and settings are securely erased from the iOS device. A macOS device locks after the final attempt. The passcode time delay begins after the sixth attempt, so if you set this value to six or lower, no time delay is imposed and the device is erased when the attempt limit is exceeded.

iOS,macOS.name: MaximumInactivityInMinutes
iOS,macOS.description:
Specifies the maximum period that a user can select, during which the device can be idle before it is automatically locked by the system. Once this limit is reached, the device is locked and the passcode must be entered. In the absence of this key, the user can select any period.
In macOS, this will be translated to screensaver settings.

iOS,macOS.name: Realm
iOS,macOS.description: The realm name for Credential payloads. Use proper capitalization for this value. This key is ignored for Redirect payloads.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionData_genericKey
iOS,macOS.description: Keys and values to pass to the app extension.

iOS,macOS.name: ExtensionIdentifier
iOS,macOS.description: The bundle identifier of the app extension that performs SSO for the specified URLs.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AdditionalGroups
iOS,macOS.description: The list of groups that are created and do not have administrator access.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AuthorizationGroups
iOS,macOS.description: The pairing of Authorization Rights to group names. The system updates the Authorization Right to use the group when used.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta_OfferPrograms_item_Token
iOS,macOS.description: The Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager seeding service token for the organization the MDM server is part of. This token is used to enroll the device in the corresponding beta program.

iOS,macOS.name: RapidSecurityResponse_EnableRollback
iOS,macOS.description: If 'false', Rapid Security Response rollbacks are not offered to the user. If 'true', Rapid Security Response rollbacks are offered to the user.

iOS,macOS.name: FilterSockets
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables the filtering of socket traffic.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyUsername
iOS,macOS.description: The user name used to authenticate to the proxy server.

iOS,macOS.name: ManagedExtensions
iOS,macOS.description: Extensions being managed

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.caldav.account
iOS,macOS.description: com.apple.caldav.account

iOS,macOS.name: CalDAVPrincipalURL
iOS,macOS.description: The base URL to the user’s calendar.

iOS,macOS.name: CardDAVUsername
iOS,macOS.description: The user name for logins.

iOS,macOS.name: LDAPSearchSettings
iOS,macOS.description: An array of search settings dictionaries.

iOS,macOS.name: AllowList_item_DeviceID
iOS,macOS.description: The device ID of the AirPlay destination in the format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx. This field isn’t case-sensitive.

iOS,macOS.name: Settings_item_Bluetooth
iOS,macOS.description: A dictionary that contains Bluetooth settings. This setting requires the Network Information access right, doesn't support User Enrollment, is only available on supervised devices, and is available in iOS 11.3 and later, and macOS 10.13.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_BasicMode_AddSquareRoot
iOS,macOS.description: Add the square root button to the basic calculator by replacing the +/- button. Normally, the square root button is available in scientific mode, so this key can be used to make it available when the scientific mode is restricted.

iOS,macOS.name: SystemBehavior_KeyboardSuggestions
iOS,macOS.description: Controls whether keyboard suggestions include math solutions

iOS,macOS.name: Calculator_BasicMode
iOS,macOS.description: If present, configures the basic mode of the calculator. Basic mode is always enabled.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.configuration.math.settings
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: EnforceLatestSoftwareUpdateVersion
iOS,macOS.description: If true, devices will upgrade to the latest OS version that is available for that device model. This uses the Software Update Enforcement configuration and will force devices to restart and install the update after the deadline passes.

iOS,macOS.name: com.apple.airprint
iOS,macOS.description: Synthetic Top Level Setting Group Collection

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingApps
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingRegion
iOS,macOS.description: The country key that profile tools use to display the proper ratings for the given region. This data isn’t recognized or reported by the client.

iOS,macOS.name: allowSafariSummary
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables the ability to summarize content in Safari.

iOS,macOS.name: allowActivityContinuation
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables activity continuation. Available in iOS 8 and later, and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowWritingTools
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables Apple Intelligence writing tools.

iOS,macOS.name: enforcedSoftwareUpdateDelay
iOS,macOS.description: Sets how many days to delay a software update on the device. With this restriction in place, the user doesn't see a software update until the specified number of days after the software update release date. This value is used by Force Delayed App Software Updates and Force Delayed Software Updates. Requires a supervised device in iOS. Available in iOS 11.3 and later, and macOS 10.13.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowMailSummary
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables the ability to create summaries of email messages manually. This does not affect automatic summary generation.

iOS,macOS.name: allowCloudPhotoLibrary
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables iCloud Photo Library. Any photos not fully downloaded from iCloud Photo Library to the device are removed from local storage. Available in iOS 9 and later, and macOS 10.12 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowCloudPrivateRelay
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables iCloud Private Relay. For iOS devices, this restriction requires a supervised device. Available in macOS 12 and later, and iOS 15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowUSBRestrictedMode
iOS,macOS.description:
If false, allows the device to always connect to USB accessories while locked. On macOS, allows new USB accessories to connect without authorization.
Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 11.4.1 and later and macOS 13 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: forceClassroomAutomaticallyJoinClasses
iOS,macOS.description: If true, automatically gives permission to the teacher’s requests without prompting the student. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 11 and later, and macOS 10.14.4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingTVShows
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: ratingMovies
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Available in iOS 4 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: allowPasswordSharing
iOS,macOS.description: If false, disables sharing passwords with the Airdrop Passwords feature. Requires a supervised device. Available in iOS 12 and later, and macOS 10.14 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: NotificationSettings_item_BadgesEnabled
iOS,macOS.description: If true, enables badges for this app. Available in iOS 9.3 and later and macOS 10.15 and later.

iOS,macOS.name: maxGracePeriod
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum grace period, in minutes, to unlock the phone without entering a passcode. The default is 0, which is no grace period and requires a passcode immediately. In macOS, this grace period value is translated to screen-saver settings.

iOS,macOS.name: customRegex_passwordContentDescription
iOS,macOS.description: Contains a dictionary of keys for supported OS language IDs (for example, “en-US”), and whose values represent a localized description of the policy enforced by the regular expression. Use the special 'default' key can for languages that aren't contained in the dictionary.

iOS,macOS.name: maxInactivity
iOS,macOS.description: The maximum number of minutes for which the device can be idle, without being unlocked by the user, before it gets locked by the system. When this limit is reached, the device is locked and the passcode must be entered. The user can edit this setting, but the value cannot exceed the Max Inactivity value. In macOS, this inactivity value is translated to screen-saver settings.

iOS,macOS.name: PasscodeReuseLimit
iOS,macOS.description: Specifies the number of historical passcode entries checked when determining whether a new passcode can be used. The device refuses a new passcode if it matches a previously used passcode within the specified passcode history range. In the absence of this key, no historical check is performed.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_TokenToUserMapping
iOS,macOS.description: The attribute mapping used when creating new users or for authorization.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_EnableAuthorization
iOS,macOS.description: Enables using identity provider accounts at authorization prompts. Requires 'UseSharedDeviceKeys' is true. The account will be assigned groups using the 'AdministratorGroups', 'AdditionalGroups', or 'AuthorizationGroups'.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AuthorizationGroups_Group
iOS,macOS.description: The group to use for the Authorization Right.

iOS,macOS.name: PlatformSSO_AuthorizationGroups_Authorization Right
iOS,macOS.description: The Authorization Right to update.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_ActionParameters_item_Domains
iOS,macOS.description: The domains for which this evaluation applies.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_URLStringProbe
iOS,macOS.description: A URL to probe. If this URL is successfully fetched (returning a 200 HTTP status code) without redirection, this rule matches.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_Action
iOS,macOS.description: The action to take if this dictionary matches the current network.

iOS,macOS.name: OnDemandRules_item_InterfaceTypeMatch
iOS,macOS.description: An interface type. If specified, this rule matches only if the primary network interface hardware matches the specified type.

iOS,macOS.name: DNSSettings_ServerName
iOS,macOS.description: The hostname of a DNS-over-TLS server used to validate the server certificate, as defined in RFC 7858. If no ServerAddresses are provided, the hostname will be used to determine the server addresses. This key must be present only if the DNSProtocol is TLS.

iOS,macOS.name: Beta_OfferPrograms
iOS,macOS.description: An array of beta programs allowed on the device. This key must only be present if the `ProgramEnrollment` key is set to `Allowed` or `AlwaysOn`. This key must not be present if the `RequireProgram` key is present. This key can be present on unsupervised devices where the `ProgramEnrollment` key is not supported but is implicitly set to `Allowed`.

iOS,macOS.name: UserName
iOS,macOS.description: The user name for the service.

iOS,macOS.name: UserDefinedName
iOS,macOS.description: The display name for this filtering configuration.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyCaptiveLoginAllowed
iOS,macOS.description: If true, allows the device to bypass the proxy server to display the login page for captive networks.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyPassword
iOS,macOS.description: The password used to authenticate to the proxy server.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyServerPort
iOS,macOS.description: The proxy server's port number.

iOS,macOS.name: ProxyPACFallbackAllowed
iOS,macOS.description: If true, allows connecting directly to the destination if the proxy autoconfiguration (PAC) file is unreachable.
